concentrate.translation[0].definitions[0: to think very carefully about something that you are doing
Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
Be quiet – let me concentrate on my homework.
I’m trying to concentrate on my work
I’m trying to concentrate in my work
concentrate.translation[0].definitions[1: to be present in large numbers or amounts somewhere, or to cause people or things to be present in large numbers or amounts somewhere
Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
Construction of the aircraft is being concentrated at Prestwick.
Women concentrate in a small number of occupations.
Concentrate is usually passive in this meaning, when used as a transitive verb
concentrate.translation[0].definitions[2: to make a substance or liquid stronger by removing some of the water from it
concentrate.translation[1].definitions[0: a substance or liquid which has been made stronger by removing most of the water from it
